name: The Peech Hotel

reviews.text: The Peech is a really fantastic choice in Johannesburg. It has the feel of a large house with the rooms around a centeral courtyard and pool area. The entire premises is protected by barbed wire, security cameras - I guess it makes you feel safe but also a little fenced in.
reviews.title: The best choice in Johannesburg

reviews.text: The rooms are modern with really high quality furnishings. The bathroom has a huge bath and separate shower. Id try request an upper floor room. The balcony is nicer than the small enclosed garden that the rooms on the first floor have.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel

likes.liked: — The tranquility of a design hotel
likes.disliked: — The limited choice of TV channels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because of security you may want to eat in the hotel after dark. The restaurant is pretty good for a hotel restaurant - though I imagine there are better eats in Johannesburg if you dare to try.
reviews.title: Best experience ever

likes.disliked: — Too quiet residential area, not so close to activities

reviews.text: There is also a huge gym literally next door. The hotel has its own entrance. There is a fee for using the gym.
reviews.title: Peaceful and comfortable retreat

reviews.text: It takes about 20 minutes from the airport and the hotel can arrange collection and drop off. It is a much more pleasant choice than the large chain hotels at the airport.
reviews.title: nearly perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in one of the suites. The room was excellent, restaurant was nice and overall styling of the hotel was great. Location also good - within easy reach of various shops and services. My only gripe was that there was no hot water when we arrived (early evening) and it hadn't even heated up in time for me to shower before dinner, despite the fact that I'd asked them to switch it on manually. We had been on a long trip travelling through Madagascar and that day had a particularly testing one. BELIEVE ME, I was looking forward to a hot shower and was pretty disappointed when the most luxurious place we stayed in all trip managed to fail in this basic regard. They were apologetic and told me that they have some eco-friendly water heating system, which is all well and good, but if you're in this market charging this kind of money then guests have a right to expect hot water whenever they arrive at the hotel. Anyway, the rest of it was great and I would stay there again, but they need to fix the above problem.
reviews.title: Chic hotel, but lack of hot water was a bit annoying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife stayed here just for the one night because our flight was delayed till the next day and the lady at the check in desk said to go here so we grabbed a taxi and got there quite quickly prices were reasonable and the staff wer very welcoming
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 2 nights,first the bad ,had a 5am pick up arranged at the airport after long flight from the uk nobody they to meet me got taxi ,room cold not the only person to complain about this,engagment party started at lunch time by early evening the host blind drunk and offencive after nasty scene asked to leave, if there is a function on nowhere private for guests,now the good ,great tour to soweto with guide from hotel made the trip, great food and location and some nice staff. I would recommend this hotel but not if there is a function on as hotel guests seam to get forgotten
reviews.title: Very happy with the Peech

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was a great experience to stay at this lovely hotel in an excellent area of jo-burg
reviews.title: absolutely wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The excellent breakfast was included in the price. the rooms were very large and well decorated. The bed was very comfortable The garden and swimming pool area was as treat. Overall highly recommended
reviews.title: A quality service oriented boutique hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Peech on 2 occasions in February 2009.
reviews.title: Thank you, Peech!

reviews.text: The hotel is a well presented boutique hotel in a secure residential neighbourhood. Quite close to the Wanderers Stadium and the commercial district of Melrose Arch (with a range of excellent restaurants) - both about 500 metres away. It is about 30 minutes to the airport (off peak) - add another 30 minutes in the peak hour.
reviews.title: Best hotel experience yet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an aside, Johannesburg Airport between 6.00pm and 9pm is a nightmare - expect lengthy (disorganised) queues and too few staff. We encountered this on 2 occasions. We arrived almost 3 hours before departure and arrived at the gate within minutes of boarding.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel - Just don't stay in Room 2

likes.liked: — It wasn't a large, impersonal hotel chain

reviews.text: The Peech Hotel is a Fantasic Hotel for Business Travellers and visitors alike. I travel at least once a month around the world and stay in boutique hotels. When I travel to Joburg, it is mainly on business and all I feel like at the end of a hectic day seeing customers is to relax and unwind.
reviews.title: An Oasis of Calm

likes.liked: — Well Priced, The Bistro, Close Proximity to the Gym, Wif Internet, Good Service, Quite Atmosphere
likes.disliked: — Dont Really Have any Dislikes....all was good

reviews.text: Most of the hotel's rooms are situated away from the main building in an elegant garden . Away from any busy roads, the hotel is quite and noise free. I always like to run in the mornings for work and the hotel is in the adjacent building to a large gym (accessed through a side gate), as well as opposite a public park where you can run.
reviews.title: Good Bboutique Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Across the road from the hotel are some small shops including a pharmacy, a cafe, bakery and a deli. What more could u want in close proximity! In terms of food, the hotel has an excellent in-house bistro with brilliant food. Definately not hotel-style food more in-line with the best fine dining food u could ask for. Try the butternut risota and tuna steaks with mash...brilliant.
reviews.title: Friendly staff; good sized comfortable room

likes.disliked: — Hearing the owner reprimanding staff in front of guests - it made us feel awkward

reviews.text: The rooms are very comfortable with good quality linen, a good powerful shower, very clean and fitted with all necessary hotel accessories such as safe, tv, phone and free internet wifi. The staff are very friendly and service excellent. On my arrival last week, I ordered my dinner at check-in and had it delivered to my room within the quoted 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.text: All in all you feel like you are staying in a stylish-yet comfortable boutique hotel not a mass-packed hotel like the one in the centre of sandton...where I used to stay before I found the Peech. Well done Mr Peech, I really can't fault your establishment.
reviews.title: Great place

description: The Peech Hotel is Joburg's hip boutique hotel. Situated centrally in Melrose (and sandwiched between Rosebank and Sandton) The Peech features ten luxurious rooms, contemporary design and plenty of good karma. The rooms are modern and edgy with an indigenous, African feel - king-sized beds and generous bathrooms featuring Raindance showers. Guests enjoy Wi-Fi, iPod sound systems and an adjacent Planet Fitness gym - "Contemporary, edgy and Afrocentric" (Conde Nast Traveller).
